title: EPISTOLA Barbara Blankenship
html:
EPISTOLA Barbara Blankenship

Re p. 7 of VERBATIM XXVII/4, I don't have a proper source for this observation, but Cackylacky sounds suspiciously like the German word Kakerlaken “cockroaches.” (And the etymology of Kakerlak bears looking into. Was it, like the English cockroach, borrowed from Spanish cucaracha and folk-etymologized into its current form?)

[Barbara Blankenship, Linguistics, UCLA]
